text: The Minnesota Journal of Law, Science & Technology is a biannual law review edited by students and faculty from the University of Minnesota. It was established in 2000 as the Minnesota Intellectual Property Review and covers issues in patents, trademarks, copyrights, bioethics, science, and technology as it relates to the law. The journal is the 6th most cited Intellectual Property law journal, 5th most cited environmental and land use law journal, 3rd most cited health, medicine & psychology law journal, and 4th most cited science, technology, and computing law journal. ==References== ==External links== * *MJLST sample Category:Publications established in 2000 Category:Intellectual property law journals Category:Biannual journals Category:University of Minnesota Category:English-language journals
title: Minnesota Journal of Law, Science & Technology
